website_summaries.verdict: Technologically advanced kettle allows for best tasting tea or coffee.
pros: 6 temperature settings allows you to customize for the best-tasting tea or coffee
cons: Customers experienced issues with kettle leaking

customer_reviews.title: Beware: chalk filter disintegrated after a few monhts
customer_reviews.text: This kettle comes with a chalk filter which, after 5 months of use, has completely disintegrated *in the water*. Unfortunately, I only found out when my daughter mentioned she had a piece of plastic in her glass. The rest of the filter was already gone at that point. I can only imagine the smaller pieces are in my stomach now. How on earth this filter can just disintegrate like that is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: Heere

customer_reviews.title: Revised review -  It quit working in less than 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Revised review - It quit working in less than 4 months. One less star for description and included directions not matching how it works. There is no memory and you need to select the temperature each time you turn it on. Each temperature is not a button, you need to press "select" and scroll through to the desired temperature each time you turn it on. Heats quickly and hold keeps it at temperature for 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Michele L

customer_reviews.title: It had a pretty consistent drip on both sides of the base
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving it after first attempt to boil water, just a few moments later a large pool of water appeared. It had a pretty consistent drip on both sides of the base. Despite the ranging good reviews, in was not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Klund

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of use, the kettle is broken. The buttons work and light up, but it no longer heats water. VERY DISAPPOINTING. I contacted Epica for a replacement and on 10/15/2018 they said they would send one out, but on 10/22/2018 I have not yet received it. Rather disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Return policy is only 3 months. 4 months in the teapot had an electrical short and now wont turn off if plugged in. Fire hazard for sure. Please be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed (rusting after the first week)
customer_reviews.text: I did my research on both Amazon and YouTube until I finally decided on this Epica. So I really had high hopes. This morning I found (only after a weeks worth of use) that the inside heating base is already showing signs of rusting. After experiencing this with cheaper brands, I made sure to ensure that water was not left over in the kettle after use and was completely drained/dried.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great for Drinking Tea in the Evenings
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help us drink more hot tea in the evenings, since we live in a cold wintry region at least half the year. We love it! It's super easy to start and set, and we especially like the "keep warm" button that holds it at our preferred temperature for 2 hours. My only complaint is a minor one: I wish it would remember the previously set temperature when it's turned on, instead of always starting at 212. But I look forward to using this for a long time, and would definitely recommend it (especially if you can get it on sale like we did)!
customer_reviews.author: E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 2016-2020. RIP Workhorse Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Oh, electric kettle! How we loved you! You were a workhorse who served us well. A family of five. Each of us drinking 8 cups of tea every day for 4 years. We boiled water for tea and rice and noodles and cleaning projects. The Stay Warm feature meant that we could start the water boiling, run down the street to the neighbors’ house, and return to hot water ready for tea. After 2 years, the filter fell out. After 3 years and 9 months, leaking began. Now, there is no heat. I just read reviews for 20 other kettles on Amazon, and nothing compares to you. <3
customer_reviews.author: Misa Cita

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Find- Very Nice kettle
customer_reviews.text: This Kettle was a really good find. The temperature settings are VERY easy to use and I like the chart it came with about which tea to use at which temperature. Also nice that I can set on lower settings for my daughter's oatmeal in the morning so it takes less time to cool. I am very very happy that I bought this kettle. I have had it for 2 weeks now and I use it several times every day. It actually does make the tea taste better when I use the lower temps for green or herbal teas. Of course the auto shut off is great so I never have to worry about boiling over. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Fit Mama

customer_reviews.title: Bottom inside rusted
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the pot on the inside it all pitted with rust...I just noticed this! No telling how long it has been rusty. That is the reason I purchased this stainless steel pot. You cant even clean it because you cant reach your hand inside because of the location of the lid!!! throwing it away and looking into getting a glass pot that is cleanable!
customer_reviews.author: RayInSeattle

customer_reviews.title: no stars if i could
customer_reviews.text: The bottom is getting rusty after about 3/4 of a years use. The buttons still work but it feels as if at least two of them may break off at any moment.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Temperatures
customer_reviews.text: I’m fairly new to artisanal teas, I bought this pot because I was told temperature is key in brewing... and that sure is the truth! Originally I was using boiling water with all teas but this pot has really changed the game and allowed me to get the right flavor. The fact that it’s cordless is another plus, being able to take the pot with me to the table during meals is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product and even worse support
customer_reviews.text: 4 months since purchase something happened to the lid and it is crooked now when open. Only partially opens now, too, so it is difficult to fill it up. So weird because all previous kettles served us for years and we treated this one with the usual care as well. Update: About a year later contacted the seller in order to replace the kettle, that is under "2 year warranty". The options are refund or replacement, but I have to send them the faulty kettle first, and pay for the shipping. It is hard to believe that they really need the 1 year old kettle back, more like distrusting the customers. Leaves a bad aftertaste from dealing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Different temperature settings for different types of tea. 2. Keep Warm option. Cons: 1. It didn't last. Stopped working (won't turn on) after just 9 months of very light use. (Full disclosure: it does turn on about 10% of the time.) 2. Poor customer service: The company has asked me to ship it back to them at my cost for a refund or replacement. The high shipping cost wouldn't make it worthwhile. 3. The button that opens the lid is temperamental. It often doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Best electric water kettle
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this water kettle! I saw this at my cousin's house and was surprised that there was a kettle with different temperature settings. It looks nice and sleek. I like that I can see the water level clearly. The different temperature settings allow me to get just the right temperature for my tea. With the lowest temperature setting, I could pour my tea and start drinking without having to wait for my drink to cool off for a few minutes. I use the highest temperature for instant oatmeal or when I need hot water for cooking. I use this everyday. I've had it for over a year and haven't had any problems with it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Useless after 1 year!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this kettle for a year now and the temperature gauge has stopped working. I don’t even use it that frequently. No matter what temp I set it at, it continues to raise hotter and hotter and hotter. It will sit there and boil nonstop and will not shut off. It’s actually kind of dangerous. I’ve burned myself a few times. I hate to buy a new kettle because it’s so wasteful, but being able to set the temperature is why I bought a kettle. I can boil water anywhere. I definitely don’t recommend buying this if you want a product that will last.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I like it. Heats the water quickly and looks attractive
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple weeks now, here are my only two complaints The button to open the lid is on top of the lid... In order to press down on the button you are then holding the lid shut, so it's difficult to open. Now i just press the button with one finger and lift the lid with a different finger The other is that it doesn't beep when the water is hot. I have to make a point of remembering, or I will wander away and forget that I heated water. Other than that I like it. Heats the water quickly and looks attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well with some quirks, but stopped working after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Heats the water quickly. Variable temperature control is nice for those of us who like to experiment with different temperatures for pour-over and French press coffee. However, you have to cycle through temperature settings with the select button which is a little bit of a nuisance. The biggest issue is that the kettle has stopped working after 10 months. Like so many others, the controls light up but the water will not heat. Sudden issue, out of the blue. Contacting for replacement, will update review with how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Lacking
customer_reviews.text: While this kettle heats quickly, has different temperature settings options which is what I wanted AND the price point was good there are some things lacking that I was not aware of when I purchased this item that were important to me. The first thing, it does not inform you when the water has boiled to the desired temperature, it just shuts off. Second, the temperature button's used to get to your desired temperature is clumsy at best. Third, I still cannot figure out how to use the warmer. If none of those items are important to you, then this is a decent kettle.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: less than two years and stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The kettle was not cheap, I used it for about 1 y and 9 months ,twice the price of any basic kettle, suddenly stopped working , i live by myself and ost of my time out of home for weeks , the kettle stills under warranty , i called customer service and they advise me tio ship it back to them (i pay for shipping) , they will try to fix it! I really will not use any of their products due to the poor quality and their return policy and warranty
customer_reviews.author: Overluck

customer_reviews.title: Metallic taste
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and boils water like it should, but it has a very strong metallic taste and I've had it for over a month. Multiple attempts at cleaning (boiling and soaping) has not gotten rid of the taste or smell yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Bought another one for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: This electric kettles performs very well, heats up water very quickly, and it's easy to operate. I use it every morning and sometimes twice a day -and I even take it with me on trips. After owning this kettle for over 2 years, I haven't had any issues with rusting, leaking or disintegration of filter, as reported by other reviewers. And frankly I do not even clean it often. And when my daughter showed interest in teas, I did not think it twice about sending her this one as a gift. Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Lili VV

customer_reviews.title: Minor but annoying malfunction
customer_reviews.text: The kettle remembers your settings (temperature and "keep warm" on or off) from one use to the next. We leave them at max temp (212 F) and "keep warm" off. Seven months after purchase, the kettle developed a malfunction of this memory feature. If the kettle shuts off automatically rather than manually, the next time we turn it on the temp has changed to 200 and "keep warm" is on. It is not hard to change it back, but it's annoying enough that we are replacing this with a different model and eating the cost. Reliability should last considerably longer than 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Almost two years later and still working perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in early 2018 and it is still working perfectly. I would certainly buy it again. it gets used multiple times a day, especially on weekends and heats water to a selected temperature and even keeps it at this temperature if you need it to. Cleans up easily. The only issue is the steam that comes out around the top gets the controls saturated in water, but I diligently wipe this off with every use since I want this thing to last another two years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ealy

customer_reviews.title: Rusted out after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: This item works the way it should, however, after only 3 months the bottom rusted out and turned the water brown every time we tried to use it. I tried to clean the rust out, but there was no ability to use it after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal M.

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse with varied temperature settings
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is a workhorse that has served us well for about 4 years of multiple-times daily use. It's not perfect: a little rust spot developed where the lid, on opening, brushed against the rim, and recently we're seeing spots around the edge of its internal heating plate. But when we got it, I feared the temperature selection buttons would wear out, and there's been no sign of them failing despite constant use. If anything other than boiling water is needed -- for coffee or teas other than black tea -- this really is a practical solution.
customer_reviews.author: Lost & Found

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My family returned from a trip to Europe recently CONVINCED that we needed one of these electric kettles. After some research I settled on this one. We've had it for a few weeks now and are very happy with it. I have definitely upped my french-press coffee game with the controlled temperature, as I used to boil a kettle on the stove and wait randomly (3 minutes? 5 minutes? Depended on how impatient I was that morning) to start brewing. Being able to set this at 190F makes for a very consistent morning cup of coffee. Did I mention speed, too? It's fast. Very pleased with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Brodd

customer_reviews.title: Hottest Purchase Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this kettle been all my life? This is such a worthwhile purchase and I'm so glad that I've upgraded my tea-sipping life! The temperature settings are accurate and very useful. I'm a serious tea lover who enjoys herbal tea all year long. This kettle allows you to easily set the temp you need for specific teas. It beeps to notify when ready and has a stay warm feature in case you can't pour it at that time. Also, it has a cord wrap feature on the bottom of the heating component for easy storage. I will be purchasing one for my BFF very soon. Everyone needs this THIS kettle in their life!
customer_reviews.author: Marshaye

customer_reviews.title: Great, but..
customer_reviews.text: The kettle does everything as expected - heats water, easy to select temperatures, beeps when water reaches selected temperature. However, the KEEP WARM function stopped working after few weeks. KEEP WARM should continue after you return the kettle to the base, but it no longer does. Really, not a huge deal, I just press START button to continue. Also, it would be helpful if the lid was removable or opened wider for cleaning. I cannot easily reach inside, my hand is simply too big.
customer_reviews.author: G. V.

customer_reviews.title: less the sound of boiling water and this kettle is perfect. Heats quickly and quietly with zero electronic button ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this kettle for our son who lives most of the year in a college dorm. He needed something that did not make noise, less the sound of boiling water and this kettle is perfect. Heats quickly and quietly with zero electronic button noise. He is very happy with his new life saver (now he can make coffee/aero press as soon as he is up in the morning!) Months later.....We bought another one for our daughter because my son was so impressed with his. I know it is just a kettle but it is one of those items in your life that you truly appreciate because it does what it's supposed to quietly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Knowsverylittle

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this kettle to brew coffee in my Aeropress on a daily basis since I purchased it. I use room temperature bottled water, and it heats a cup worth in about 30 seconds to the temperature you want (I like 175). When I first bought the kettle, I tested the water temperature using a very accurate thermapen, and it was spot on (+/- .5 degrees Fahrenheit). This makes it super convenient for brewing coffee or similar beverages where you want a precise temperature. So basically it does everything I needed it to: -Decent price -Appears to be good build quality -Looks nice -Easy to use -Fast heating -Accurate temperatures -Great for coffee brewing -Fair price
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: great product for almost half price compare to other re-branding ones
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on sale for $45 and I glad I bought it. I saw many other brands with same exactly product, but they were more expensive just because of the brand. It looks to me they are from same ODM and re-banding. The quality of this product, Epica, looks great, works great and the temperature settings/functions are perfectly sufficient. I also bought a second one for my parent.
customer_reviews.author: Liem H.D. Vo

customer_reviews.title: One-click temperature setting would be preferable; otherwise great!
customer_reviews.text: The kettle is easy to use, with the water level clearly visible and the various temperature settings clearly indicated. I'd like to be able to select a temperature as a default, or with one button press though; clicking through the temperatures to get to the one I want (200, for French Press) every time is annoying, and I'm concerned that the button will wear out quickly also. I like a beep / tone to indicate that the temperature has been reached; I don't like the feeling that I'm at an ATM when I just want to select the same temperature as yesterday morning. #firstworldproblems
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Nice kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I haven’t had it long enough to comment on its durability in the long run, but so far it has worked really well for me. It’s very easy to use, really quick, and the temperature settings are so convenient. I use this for my French press a lot and it’s annoying to watch the thermometer and wait for it to get down from boiling to exactly the correct temperature, and it’s also good for tea - much faster than boiling water on the stove. I’ve used more expensive models in the past and this works exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tea kettle for 9 months, so it's unfortunate that I have to rate it so poorly now. Unfortunately, it only took 9 months for it to stop working. Now the light turns on but the water never boils. Save your money and go for another model. If anyone from the company is reading this, I'd love an explanation on how working for only 9 months is satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: annamariaman

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle, great price!
customer_reviews.text: After sorting through all the electric kettles I picked this one. It has all the features I wanted including multiple temperature settings and a keep,warm function. I've been using it for a little over a week now and it had been preforming perfectly, I've measured the actual temperatures and they are holding within a couple of degrees of the set temp. All in all, this is a great kettle at a great price. The shipping was very fast (Prime) and it arrived in great shape. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Concord Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Kettle
customer_reviews.text: This kettle works great and heats water very quickly. I bought it because I read that there are slightly different optimal temperatures for brewing each tea type (color). I love that it has different temperature settings, and the guide even has a section on which temperature is best for each tea. My only complaint would be that, while the temp settings are in Fahrenheit, the water level indicator is in liters, so it's hard to know if I'm filling with the right amount of water.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: The Best electric kettle around
customer_reviews.text: I have had this electric kettle for about 2 months. It heats water quickly. My tea and coffee have never tasted better. I did not believe that different temperatures would matter in brewing tea and coffee but it does. I now get all kinds of complements from my family and friends on the taste of my coffee and tea. The kettle is easy to clean. I like the way the kettle can swivel so I can grap the handle at any time. I am so happy I bought this kettle. I would highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It heats water quickly and to the temperature you want it.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good customer service, the lid broke outside of the return window and they still replaced it. Heats quickly to a number of desired temperatures. Easier and less messy than a stovetop kettle. Cons: The lid design isn't quite as good, engineering wise. It came loose after about 4 months. The temperature is in farenheit, rather than celsius, as is appropriate for water temp, or everything but weather. Stubborn Americanism. Overall, it's been good.
customer_reviews.author: Sephethus

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice Product I find the variable temperature settings to be very useful. Tea and coffee brewed from water at the proper (not too hot) temperature really taste smoother. I believe the very hot temperatures bring out the underlying bitterness of the tea leaves or coffee grinds. My beverages are much smoother tasting when brewed correctly. It is easy to set and keep temps properly warm for the next cup. The guide under the handle is easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylethe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice for an electric kettle.
customer_reviews.text: Very fast heating electric kettle. I have used this several times since I purchased about a 2 months ago. No issues whatsoever and it does heat up within a few minutes. The different settings are explained in the manual, for example black tea requires a certain temperature to get the ideal flavor/avoid scorching) I use it for french press coffee but again this is a versatile kettle, I will update in a few months but expect it last! It feels very well built and the buttons have a satisfying feel to them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great features
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it will do. Bought first one for the office. We've had it, and been using it, for a couple of months. With near constant use, it's holding up beautifully. Getting a second one for home, I love it so much. I will say, you will need to have small hands to get into it to scrub inside. But a brush will do the job, if necessary. It is stainless steel, though, so not like it's going to look a wreck anytime soon, unless you have hard water. I suspect there are parts inside you'd want to take care scrubbing around, but I haven't had to scrub the one at the office, yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in ~18 months....
customer_reviews.text: We have tea at least twice a day pretty much every day, so it did get use, but its been working intermittently for about 2 weeks now, and today it won't work at all. I am mortified because not long after we bought one for our home, we bought one for a wedding gift. This was a very nice kettle. The only real downside for us while it worked was that it did not alert you when the water had boiled. You have to watch for the light to go out... IF you decide this is the kettle for you, get the warranty!
customer_reviews.author: mswring

customer_reviews.title: Quality electric kettle with hard to find variable temperature settings that works!
customer_reviews.text: This electric kettle is very well constructed and super easy to use. It has a variable temperature option for heating water for different types of teas or coffee. This has worked very well and has made a big difference in the taste of the teas and coffee that I make. The keep warm function is very handy. This is much better than the Oster variable temp electric kettle that we needed to replace as it failed at 18 months, outside of the warranty period of only one year. And this item has a two year warranty. The seller is
customer_reviews.author: NBalzer

customer_reviews.title: Good? I would say it is Fair.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April 2018 and used it a fair amount. I started having problems with the unit over the last few months. The pin on the lid came out, and it is impossible to get it back in. The next problem is that it randomly leaks out the bottom of the unit. It will be fine for a few days, then leak all the water out. I was initially happy with it because you could select the temperature, but it doesn't seem like it is made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Zograph

customer_reviews.title: Short Life
customer_reviews.text: I saw a ton of great product reviews for this kettle, but unfortunately, it did not survive in our household. We brew hot water at least 4-5 times a week. After less than 6 months, there seemed to be an issue between the base and the kettle which caused it to not power up anymore. After contacting the manufacturer, I did not receive a response.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What more could you ask of an electric kettle?
customer_reviews.text: With Stainless steel construction this kettle comes up to temp quickly. Making tea or coffee or even boiling water for pasta much quicker than waiting for a stove top kettle to boil. It has many different temperature settings and the keep warm function works well if I walk away and get caught up in something. I will still come back to water hot enough for my needs and no boil over!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast boiler, too quiet
customer_reviews.text: I regularly make green and white teas, so I'm particular about what temperature I need. I used to have a water boiler without temperature settings, so this replaced my old one. It does what is says - boils fast, easy to select your temperature and sleekly designed. My one complaint is that there is no "beeping when done" setting. It's a little tricky to tell when the water has reached the right temperature so you have to keep an eye on it. Other than that, I'm happy with this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie R

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely excited to receive this teapot as it boasts a 2 hour keep warm feature. After using this pot I discovered that the keep warm function does NOT keep the water warm for 2 hours . It barely keeps the water warm for 15 minutes. Additionally the selection buttons do not illuminate showing if the pot has reached its temperature or if the teapot is actually on. Everything is a guessing game. I am returning this pot as I am extremely disappointed with it. If you're looking for a good functioning teapot with dependable features this is not the teapot to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: A great electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: We've had this kettle for a few weeks now and use it daily to make french press coffee. I love that we can set the optimal temperature for brewing and that it has the "keep warm" feature if we're not ready to use it right away. It is quick and easy to use. Goodbye tea kettles! This is quicker, easier, and having the water at just the right temp makes for much better coffee. I don't use the filter that came that sits over the inside of the spout. I guess it's there in case you're brewing loose tea inside? Not sure.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kettle to use at my office to make tea and coffee. I probably used it an average of less than once per day. After about 6 months it just quit working all together. The lights come on, but the water stays stone cold. I contacted Epica and was somewhat rudely told that I had to pay to ship it back and I had to include a laundry list of information that had to be included when I returned it. The requirements were rattled off so quickly by the service rep that I couldn't get everything down. Save your money and buy from a reputable brand that stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: SteveThreePO

customer_reviews.title: Great product for heavy and casual users!
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting for a few weeks to assess the real deal and the experience. So far we are super happy. It is light, fast, handle is well position and not getting hot and full of good features (keep warm works great) and all is operating as expected. We are heavy users so we use it about 20 times a day and it is holding firm. Good product and as I understand from an American small business. I'm proud of them and we should keep supporting our small businesses.
customer_reviews.author: Koby

customer_reviews.title: Best, but no beep.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Best for the price, but with one feature lacking. Our previous, much more spendy kettle, recently deceased, beeped quietly for 3 seconds to alert us that the water had reached the correct temp. With this one it just shifts to the Keep Warm mode once it reaches the desired temp. I have to stay in the kitchen and keep an eye on it, so I don't get distracted and forget that I have water boiling. But I'm sure that adding an "Alert Beep" would add to the very reasonable price. And this keeps me on my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Evening Reader

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit nervous ordering this because of some of the reviews. But needed something which would keep us from burning the house down when it went dry. Have only had it 3 weeks but so far it is everything as advertised. I love the various temperature settings and that I can keep it at a certain temperature for 2 hours. It is easy to fill and so far have had no issues with rust or not working that others have complained of. I use it pretty much all day every day and am quite happy with it. Heats up quickly and I am no longer burning my tongue from boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: sc34

customer_reviews.title: Glad to have temperature options
customer_reviews.text: Great electric water kettle and happy that it has various temperature settings. We use ours all the time. Especially, when we need to boil noodles or require boiling water for whatever reason. Boiling water with the electric kettle at max capacity and max temperature takes a couple of minutes versus waiting for water to boil on the stove for nearly 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: haha_yeahTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: but this amazing kettle is worth the little price difference
customer_reviews.text: I've had electric kettles made of plastic, but this amazing kettle is worth the little price difference...it's got style, and better, it heats water very fast and hold the temperature well...and there are six temps for various types of tea as well as just to warm water for non-tea making uses. Unlike some other steel kettles that are quite heavy, this one is very sturdy but not heavy even when full of water...I'm really pleased with this kettle and have been using it a lot for all sorts of things...e.g., preheating soup broth, etc.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: My Mr. Coffee that I used for tea suddenly quit working. As I was searching for a replacement I realized an electric kettle would be a better choice. This kettle didn’t meet all the criteria I initially was looking for ( I wanted a thermal pot) but I realized the ability to control the temperature was a way better trade off. The Epica 6 kettle heats quickly, and keeps the water warm. BTW I haven’t burned myself on the hot kettle, nor is that likely because it’s so well designed. The first 3 times I used it the top would pop open when it reached temperature but it stopped as suddenly as it began. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: bootfloozie guy

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the tea and coffee drinker
customer_reviews.text: It is wonderful! I push the start button and it heats 1.7 liters (7.1 Cups) in about 8 minutes. A few great features are; It has a graduated window so you can see how much water is left, It has an insulated bottom so that it can be set on your hand or the surface of a table or serving tray. If you are using only one liter of water it heats within 5 minutes. The pouring spout is very good, and gives the ability for precision pouring for tea and coffee making.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Reliability
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Epica tea kettle and I have also given two as gifts. It is reliable and easy to use. The variable temperature allows the perfect temperature for my French press, black tea as well as green and herbal teas. One wouldn’t think temperature could matter that much but for perfect coffee and teas, temperature is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Steinbecks Shadow

customer_reviews.title: If you want water at a particular temperature, this electric kettle my be for you.
customer_reviews.text: This electric kettle hold plenty of water and justs works well. The fact that you can chose your final temperature and don't have to monitor the temperature makes this much easier to use. I make coffee with water that I want at a particular temperature and now I can just chose one of the presets. There is also a keep warm button which is also useful. I measure the temperature of water once it reached a particular temperature. It was well within the five degrees Fahrenheit that I wanted. Plenty good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Mehlman

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this electric tea kettle, our 3rd one now in the past 10 years and have been very pleased...until today when I came home to it having leaked all over the kitchen counter. It lasted a year and 2 months. Very, very disappointed at such a short life. The other 2 we enjoyed both lasted almost 3 years each. In actuality, since we very seldom use the tea kettle during the summer, it really only lasted one full winter, which is completely unacceptable. If it were possible to return it, we certainly would!
customer_reviews.author: cheryl meng

customer_reviews.title: Glad we got it
customer_reviews.text: I debated over different models, but the temperature control is great and a luxury feature that you don't think about until you actually use it. My kids have 'kids temperature' for their tea. I like my tea at a certain temperature and my husband likes his tea very hot, so now everyone can use the kettle and specify their ideal temperature and not add ice cubes or turn off the kettle in the middle of a cycle in order to get the temperature they prefer.
customer_reviews.author: phoenix rising

customer_reviews.title: Put the kettle on Mildred we've got company  . . . .
customer_reviews.text: Oh how I love my new Epica!!! I've recently become obsessed with Matcha tea which requires a particular temperature of water. I did my research and found this beautiful piece of art to add to my kitchen. Make sure it's filled the night before then I turn it on, set the temp and press the keep warm button while feeding my cats. When I've completed my morning routine it's back to the kitchen for the ritual preparation of the tea and the Epica is right there with perfectly heated water to pour over my Matcha. I couldn't be happier to send my old kettle off to the Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: mgHanna

customer_reviews.title: Very nice electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: I have used this kettle only a short time but it came with good instructions that were easy to follow including a "cheat sheet" for various teas. It heats the water very quickly. The temperature controls are easy to use and I very much like that you can choose so many different ones that accommodate all kinds of tea that need to steep in different temperatures. I have made it a habit to tilt the kettle after use so it can dry out completely as I had a different stainless steel kettle before that started to leak after less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Seems like an excellent kettle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter. She has a Vava electric kettle at her office and wanted one for home but the price has gone way up on those. So I researched and found the Epica hot water kettle. The features seem identical to the Vava and it works great. She is very happy with this kettle and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to the Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I was deciding between this and the Cuisinart one that similar but also almost $50 + more than this one. My sister has the Cuisinart so I’m familiar with it, but I love this one! I’m hoping it lasts a long time. I use it daily for your hot tea while my husband uses it for coffee and I love the different settings you can do for the different temperatures. No issues so far
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithful
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this kettle almost two years ago and couldn’t be happier with it. It is easy to use, heats water quickly, looks nice, and doesn’t take up much space. It doesn’t have a feature that alerts you when the water is at temperature, but we always use the “keep warm” feature so that water will be still be hot when we go to make our coffee (with a Chemex) or tea. We use it every day and no problems. Are going to order another one for our summer house!
customer_reviews.author: Annie B.

customer_reviews.title: Broken and a Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Warning to all: I purchased this in February 2018. It worked well until last week when it seemed to stop heating water. I noticed after three or four "presses" it started - for a few days. Then it stopped altogether EXCEPT now it randomly starts without any manual help from me! If there was little or no water left in the unit it could potentially be a fire hazard - not to mention that it does not work at all when the Start button is pressed. Obviously, it has been disposed of. Don't waste your money - look further for a more reliable kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Pebbles

customer_reviews.title: Great variable temperature kettle for the price
customer_reviews.text: This kettle replaced a more expensive variable kettle which we had for several years even though it stopped working properly about a year after we bought it. This new Epica kettle works so well. It boils faster and turns off when it should. The only thing it doesn't do is signal when it has reached the set temperature but that is no big deal. The temperature selections are perfect for all the teas we have in our house. If you are looking for a variable temperature kettle, this is the one. Don't waste your money on the more expensive ones!
customer_reviews.author: B. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted but you have to always reset temp
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done with one minor annoyance: you have to set it to the temperature you want every time b/c it does it does not automatically remember/hold your last setting. My older one is a Cuisnart and you don’t need to do that. Update: this appliance has died and it has not yet been 2 years. My Cuisinart electric kettle lasted almost 8 years. Now I have to buy a third kettle in less than a decade ...
customer_reviews.author: Tara Makhmali

customer_reviews.title: The "stay warm" feature is great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing and the convenience its given me. I haven't had any issues but it feels like the handle is a little weak, sometimes when it's full I worry that it might come apart. But again I haven't had any issues and it might just be me still getting use to a completely different type of kettle. I'm so glar I bought this though and it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: ATS

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced kettle
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Epica tea kettle as a replacement for my kettle which stopped working. I have been very satisfied with this purchase, especially the variable temperature options. I drink tea every day, and I have been very pleased with this option. It is also very reasonably priced. As for the comments regarding the exterior of the kettle getting hot, yes that is the case. However, that has been the case for every stainless steel kettle I have purchased. If you don't want this to happen, it may be better to purchase a plastic kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Great for brewing anything at the perfect temperature!
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is amazing! An excellent alternative to a stove-top kettle that makes a lot of noise and can take forever if there's a lot of water. It also allows us to control the temperature for each beverage we're trying to brew which enhances the flavor the tea or coffee we're drinking. I'm very happy with this and will be enjoying this for many years, I'm sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with this: well made, works well
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I dragged our heals about getting one of these even though we boil water daily but we've been extremely pleased with this. The controls take a bit of time getting used to so maybe it deserves a 4.9 stars but I won't quibble. It seems very well made with the only part that feels a bit amateur is the plastic lid. It seems to boil water fast although I don't have anything to compare against. The various different temperatures are really great for cocoa versus tea versus coffee jobs. I've only had it 3-4 months but so far we are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Watson

customer_reviews.title: It Does My All
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for a great price. I have just had it a short time so I can’t speak to it’s durability but otherwise it’s as advertised. It heats fast. Variable temperatures is a definite plus. I don’t know if all have 360 degree turning but I use it all the time. I use the water level window so I can heat just enough when using the drip cone for my thermos to make coffee. Bottom line, it’s become my early morning improvement of the year or two or three.
customer_reviews.author: Adfinem

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: It broke four months after the warranty expired. In my experience companies will honor warranties a few months after they expire to not give the impression the device is engineered to last only the length of the warranty. Epica did not - they flatly said there was nothing they would do. I would have appreciated an explanation as to why they thought this was a good business practice. Anyway, I certainly can't recommend purchase with only a two year lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Won't reach 212 degrees
customer_reviews.text: While i understand that the temp of the water once poured into a cup or other container will drop, I've never found that this truly heats up to 212 degrees, even when measuring the temp in the kettle itself. The tops is maybe 195. update 3.6.19: the pot leaks
customer_reviews.author: Sharon G.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, though not without flaws
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for several weeks now, using it every day for tea, and am generally pleased with it. It heats water quickly and is attractive. I appreciate the lower settings for green teas, oolongs, and Chinese black teas, all of which I prefer to brew at under 200F. Cons: the temperature controls are not accurate - some settings result in water that is hotter than indicated and some cooler - so I’m still having to use my tea thermometer. Also, when you try to get to the last bit of water, it can spill out sometimes. Overall, though, a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: The price on this was great but the quality of this product is on par ...
customer_reviews.text: What a steal! The price on this was great but the quality of this product is on par with one that would be closer to $90 in price. I especially like the temperature variability option.
customer_reviews.author: Diana D.

customer_reviews.title: Like the Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dorm room to mimic the Cuisinart stainless steel temperature variable tea kettle my parents have, and it works identically. It holds a good amount of water, and I like the measurement part of it. The different temperature settings are nice, easy to use, and pretty effective. The stainless steel also leaves the water pure and without any plastic-y flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Chic Stainless Electric Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I really like this kettle. I have been using it for the past two weeks and it makes my life a lot easier when I prepare my coffee and tea. I would give it a 5- star review if reaching the temperature was also announced by a beep (as in other electrical kettles I used). In my model, this is indicated only visually; when the temperature is reached, the light indicating the set temperature goes off or the "keep warm" button flashes if it was activated in advance. This is a bit discreet and at times it makes me check on it before the temperature is reached. Other than that, I love my new kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeeman

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this Epica several times daily since Christmas day. So far, it's performed as promised. We're feeling good about the materials used in the design. This product replaced our $9.99, 10 year old plastic tea kettle-- which also had an exposed metal element. The only surprise was a set of slightly burned fingers resulting from touching the pot while it was hot. My bad! (Old kettle was cool to the touch.) If the life of this tea kettle is anything close to our cheaper pot, I'll really be delight. We also purchased extended warranty- we enjoy keeping items that we like for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: jackie0

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Heats fast.  Super easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It was highly rated and less expensive than the "Amazon Choice" brand name. This works amazing. Water heats up quickly. Easy to read all of the settings, easy to push all of the buttons. It is also easy to open and when you push the plastic button on top of the kettle to open it, you do not touch the hot metal or the steam, so your fingers stay safe. The "keep warm" function works wonderfully as well as the memory function that remembers your setting while you pour a cup of tea. We are very happy that we bought this.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable! Stopped working in a little over a year
customer_reviews.text: UNRELIABLE PRODUCT AND A NON-EXISTENT CUSTOMER SERVICE. It stopped working about a year and one month after the purchase. Multiple attempts to reach customer service has been unsuccessful. I wrote to them through their website, I sent them an email, I called them on the phone and left a message—to no avail. NO! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO A FRIEND. (NEITHER TO A FOE) BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK...
customer_reviews.author: Igor Y Ovchinnikov

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kettle - stopped working in less than 5 months. No hassle replacement with warranty.
customer_reviews.text: In less than five months this Epica boiler fritzed out and stopped working. The light on the handle still lit up but it stopped heating the water at all. Before that it worked fine. Too bad. (update two days later) Contacted Epica customer service to ask about their two year warranty on this product. They are sending me a new one right away. Very happy with that kind of customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Kieffer

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after 1 year and Protection Plan does not cover it
customer_reviews.text: It started to leak water after 1 year use although it was not used vigorously. I purchased SquareTrade 4-Year Small Appliance Protection Plan ($25-49.99). But the Protection Plan does not cover it. It said it is "physical defect/damage". Called Amazon customer services twice and the advice is to contact the manufacturer. Disappointed in the quality of the Kettle and the quality of the Protection Plan. It took a lot of hassle to resolve this $40 kettle.
customer_reviews.author: penname

customer_reviews.title: Good until it stopped working just after the 2 yr warranty ended--Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: It was very convenient to use although I burned myself 3 or 4 times touching the metal body accidentally. I am genuinely disappointed that without having moved, dropped or mishandled my kettle, it stopped working just after the 2 year warranty. When I reached out to Epica about whether there was any assistance available like repair, they only said "Too bad." I'm disappointed with their customer service as I would have bought several extra for loved ones as gifts but they seem to know their product will break by 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Annie P

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with everything about this product
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with everything about this product. I was originally thinking I would go with the $70 Cuisinart, but I decided to go with this Epica product for only $40, and it has been entirely worth it. I have no complaints. There is no "plastic" smell or taste as some have complained. It heats up very quickly and is the way to go if you frequently make coffee or tea (or oatmeal, or anything else that requires hot water!). I haven't verified temperatures with a thermometer, but if they're off at all, it can't be very much.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Love this hotpot
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have owned of this brand. The first one was used daily for at least 3 years before it finally quit on me. The new one has an added feature that it automatically stays on the same temp each time you turn it on instead of having to reset it each time. Heats quick, easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Bizzy Me

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hot water carafe for a cabin that has no instant hot water faucet. I tried it at home and it works as well as advertised. It heats water quickly and holds enough water to refill my cup over the course of a day. The quality seems to be as advertised. This hot water carafe will be used in a dry climate so I don't anticipate any rust issues on the lid. I recommend this seller and this hot water heating device.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: It's great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's great for the price, and solidly built. I bought this to replace a little Japanese kettle that was faster and quieter, but didn't have temperature control. It's a bit of a trade off, but not having to fiddle with the temperature after cooking the water is worth it. A couple of design quirks: 1) It doesn't beep or give any indication that it's finished, other than switching off -- so when you leave it on "keep warm" mode, it's easy to forget about. 2) The lid doesn't come off. You'll need to use a bottle brush to clean the interior if your hands are even moderately large.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works great, only 2 potential problems
customer_reviews.text: The capacity is perfect. It heats very quickly. I also like the different temperatures so I can get my water to the ideal temp for the type of tea. My favorite feature is the kettle is cordless. I can fill it in the sink without fear of getting the cord wet. I only have 2 complaints. It gets very hot to the touch on the outside, so be careful. Also it has a rim on the opening. If something accidently gets in the water, it's very hard to get it out just by dumping the water.
customer_reviews.author: buckeyedeb

customer_reviews.title: Love the product
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. It arrived very quickly. It is so convenient and easy to use. People are complaining that they don't know when the water is hot enough. When you first press start, the start button lights up. When the water is ready, the light goes out. If you want to keep it warm for up to 2 hours, press the start button again, then press warm which will stay lit for up to 2 hours. It looks great on my kitchen counter too.
customer_reviews.author: Flowergal

customer_reviews.title: Good product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: This electric kettle is well-designed and crafted for durability. It may be challenging to clean the inside since cover is not detachable but a good long-handle brush should do. I reported a minor problem with the cover and got immediate response within 24 hrs and replacement within 72 hours (delivered on Sunday).
customer_reviews.author: VBC

customer_reviews.title: Very good kettle.  We are on our second one.
customer_reviews.text: We probably use our water kettles more than most. We heat tea water on average 3 hours every single day. We've been through two other makes (forget which) before buying this one. In April of 2018 we bought our first Epica. It lasted 15 months of extremely heavy use before it stopped working (element burned out, is my guess). We liked it so much and consider the "wear-out" acceptable due to our heavy use, so we just purchased another identical one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Got this in awhile ago and it works great. It will heat up water when full
customer_reviews.text: Got this in awhile ago and it works great. It will heat up water when full, with cold water 7-10 mins. After it is done it will keep the water hot for a surprising amount of time before you have to heat it up again or use the keep warm button. It pours water out fairly quickly so have to watch out for that part when putting some in a cup. The lid is a nice seal around it. So far I had no trouble with it and we use it A LOT in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Nite

customer_reviews.title: The variety of temperature for any known tea and also coffee .
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cordless electric kettle. At last I can make that perfect cup of my very favorite green tea ! It is also eye pleasing. The only missing thing I think is sound at the end of heating time, but I still like the kettle and I am keeping it ! Thank you !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I live to drink very warm fresh water and do not like to drink cooled water that was once boiled, so used to heat my water in a small pot just for myself. My husband usually drinks black tea several times a day and uses microwave oven to boil his water. Now we can use this kettle and enjoy our tea-time together without those hustle! Love the sleek design and stainless steel body!
customer_reviews.author: Oksana

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: Stopped heating after 18 months. Worked well until then. One annoying thing is that if you boiled water, then want to boil a second time, opening and closing the lid will likely splatter you hand with near-boiling water as it latches and unlatches. The lid latch isn’t as nice as one would hope.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Perks

customer_reviews.title: Good Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Being English by birth we make lots of tea and an electric kettle is a necessity! We have tried stove top ones but don't really like them, so when the switch on our previous kettle broke we looked for a new one. The Epica 6 is a fine kettle, doesn't take long to boil, is reasonably quiet and no it doesn't have a sound when it has finished boiling although the little red lights do go out. I don't think you will be displeased with your purchase, we are not.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Burton

product_meta.title: Epica 6-Temperature Variable Stainless Steel Cordless Electric Kettle
feature_bullets: FOR BETTER TASTING TEA AND COFFEE | 100% BPA FREE: If you’re using the same-temp water for green tea as you are for your coffee, you’re missing out: Finding an ideal water temperature brings out the best flavors. With the Epica 6-temperature kettle, every drink you make can be a little closer to perfection. It even advises which temps to use for which beverage!

FASTEST BOILING | FOR WHEN YOU NEED A QUICK CUP: Only have a few minutes for break? Have someone drop by unexpectedly? Stop waiting 10+ minutes for water on the stove to get hot. This Epica kettle brings the heat quicker than any stove-top kettle. And with our Cooltouch handle and automatic shut-off, it’s perfect for offices or homes.

SLEEK NEW DESIGN | BRING BEAUTY TO ANY COUNTERTOP: Designed with beautiful stainless steel design paired with an excellent build quality—this kettle is an attractive addition to any kitchen. At Epica, we know that it you can’t just be the best—you also have to look good doing it.

PROGRAM WITH EASE: The Epica kettle has a two hour keep-warm button. It also has a two-minute setting memory that’s lightning fast to use, so your water is ready at the temperature you want whenever you need it.
TWO YEAR WARRANTY: This kettle is made with the highest quality materials. If you have any problems in the first two years, we’ll replace it free of charge.
